website_summaries.verdict: A rugged hydration pack, but others on our shortlist are more spacious and offer better quality.
pros: Provides ample water and gear storage space
A sleek design at a mid-range price
cons: The straps fit snugly, especially on large and tall users
Not as comfortable as some other models

customer_reviews.title: Generally nice bag, but shoulder straps hug the neck
customer_reviews.text: I can't speak to longevity with use; I only tried it on before deciding to return it. It's generally a nice bag. Good color combination, nice slim size like I've been seeking, and I like the design for opening the bladder to fill/clean. My issue with it is the shoulder straps being too close together at the top, so the seam rubs against your neck. I know that will irritate my neck over the course of a hike (and will surely just pick up all the sunscreen in that area). Other slim packs I've tried have the straps wider and/or direct outwards more, so they stay away from the neck.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin F.

customer_reviews.title: not bad for the price
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight pack and great for the price. It can be better though. The back of the bag which keeps contact with your back doesn't have any webbing in the center or spacing to keep it from making direct contact with you because of this you will start feeling pretty hot on your back from wearing it all day. the bladder looks cheaply made and I question how long it will last before I buy a nicer one. for the price it works well though and I think I went into it with the right expectation. Also the bite valve has no dedicated on off like the nicer ones just a stand alone bite value.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Crifasi

customer_reviews.title: Great backpack!
customer_reviews.text: I love this backpack. It is perfect for my commutes to work. It is light and small, but big enough to take cloths, lunch and small pump and tube repair kit just in case. The water bladder isn't too bad either. I've only used it once but it seemed to work well, no leaks as others were saying. It has a pouch in the front that is perfect for holding my phone and wallet away from the main compartment which I really like.
customer_reviews.author: J. Hornberger

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for day hikes.
customer_reviews.text: The bag itself is really practical. Ditch the water bladder that comes with it. I put my own 3L bladder in it, and it works out just fine. Plenty of room for snacks/lunch, keys/wallet, and a light layer (like a raincoat, sun shirt, or flannel) between the various pockets. The compression straps are handy. Very good as a day hike pack.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: Love this bag! I took it with me to Universal Studios and I had water the entire day at the parks! It has lots of pockets:) When the water bag is full u can't keep a whole lot inside but it's still pretty awesome and the green color is awesome too!
customer_reviews.author: framthisheart

customer_reviews.title: Terrific in every way
customer_reviews.text: Terrific in every way. Convenient pockets and locations, strong, yet not bulky at all, and fits comfortably. The water bladder system works without fail.
customer_reviews.author: Coach Fun

customer_reviews.title: Bladder leaks when I use it for skiing. I ...
customer_reviews.text: Bladder leaks when I use it for skiing. I guess sitting on the chair causes the water to escape from the very funky design of the bladder.
customer_reviews.author: laurelee

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic value for the money
customer_reviews.text: Great backpack; the main compartment is a little small and the zipper sometimes gets caught in the rain flap, but overall it's way cheaper than other options (while still being a quality product) and saved my life many times at Burning Man.
customer_reviews.author: Yu Jiang

customer_reviews.title: She loves it - it's the perfect size for her since she's more petite and many ...
customer_reviews.text: Got it for my girlfriend since we do a lot of hiking. She loves it - it's the perfect size for her since she's more petite and many packs end up being way too big on her.
customer_reviews.author: Haus

customer_reviews.title: it was a good buy. I will say that the bladder is ...
customer_reviews.text: For the money, it was a good buy. I will say that the bladder is a pain...challenging to handle in the dark especially. It's got this weird fold and slide system...the Camelbak bladders are soooo much better...any bladder that's got a spout you can unscrew is better than this. The bite valve worked great, the size was good, has enough room to hold a few things like kleenex, lip balm, smokes, gum, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Aroara Boryahlis

customer_reviews.title: I definitively love it!
customer_reviews.text: Great room for the minimal equipment at your hiking route. 2lt bladder for water (the locking system of the bladder is not quite comfortable but it works perfectly, you don't miss a drop of water) an 8lt room for small items, an extra net for your helmet if you ride a bike, i could add a waterproof sleeve for cellphone or a wallet.
customer_reviews.author: Giancarlo Guidobono

customer_reviews.title: we are happy with the product but after two uses
customer_reviews.text: Overall, we are happy with the product but after two uses, on of the Velcro straps inside pulled loose from the seam. Because it is a stabilizing strap for the bladder, it's not a significant issue but I'd like to see some stronger seams.
customer_reviews.author: WT15

customer_reviews.title: It is a good size bag with a good size water housing and ...
customer_reviews.text: It is a good size bag with a good size water housing and descent storage space. The system used to close the bladder is a little bit strange and I do not fully trust it yet, but it hasn't leaked.
customer_reviews.author: Pablo A. Magallanes

customer_reviews.title: Love the design of th case but after using two ...
customer_reviews.text: Love the design of th case but after using two times the mouthpiece began to leak all over while we were running, ordered a replacement because we thought it was a fluke and after a few uses the second one was leaking again. Because I like the look of the hydration pack I plan on buying a bladder from another brand that will hopefully not have as many issues.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Backpack is great; the nozzle from the hydration pack started to ...
customer_reviews.text: Backpack is great;the nozzle from the hydration pack started to leak after a day so I ended up getting one of the cheap walmart hydration packs to replace it and have had no problems since. Highly recommend this product for music festivals and anything outdoors! Lots of storage too which is definitely a plus!
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This backpack is amazing. It's easy tp fill up and clean. I wear it everytime I go biking.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awsome bag!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this bag for a 2 week camping trip to Nova Scoita and New Foundland and it was great for day hikes. It doesn't look like it has much space, but I managed to keep the water bladder filled at about 2L and carried lots of small rock samples and snacks for hours. It defiantly worked for me and I'd recommend it to friends.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Nuhn

customer_reviews.title: Great value.
customer_reviews.text: Used this at Disneyland and it worked as expected. Great value.
customer_reviews.author: A. Pearson

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This was PERFECT for my two week mountain biking / camping adventure.
customer_reviews.author: Jeana Midgette

customer_reviews.title: LOVING IT
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this because I have a High Sierra 40L backpack that I love and have abused, so I trust the brand. It's my first hydration pack and so far so good! It's sturdy and just the right size to carry a few extra things with your water if you're going on a short day trip.
customer_reviews.author: Kristina

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice pack. 80% as good as an osprey Hydrogen pack that cost 3 times as much.
customer_reviews.author: troy j.d.

customer_reviews.title: Does the job it's suppose to
customer_reviews.text: It's fairly small, but if just using for riding/running/hiking then it's perfect. Hydration pack has never leaked for me.
customer_reviews.author: Grayson Stopp

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: So far so good, for money you can't beat it.
customer_reviews.author: brian

customer_reviews.title: fine
customer_reviews.text: Good element, is very portable, had a nice style and is very comfortable is good for trainer on the mountain is good
customer_reviews.author: Oscar

customer_reviews.title: Great pack!
customer_reviews.text: Great pack! Small yet capable. It was very comfortable to wear all day every day on my 5 day trip.
customer_reviews.author: Stuart

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as I expected. No issues. No leaks ...
customer_reviews.text: Exactly as I expected. No issues. No leaks. More than enough room for what you need for a day hike.
customer_reviews.author: Megan Mick

customer_reviews.title: Designed with a hole at the bottom
customer_reviews.text: There is a designed 1" hole at the center bottom seam of the pack that leads into the main compartment. Not been able to figure out its purpose - nothing noted on the product tag and I couldn't find anything on the Internet. Having a hole at the bottom of bag is not anything I would consider favorable, especially for a technical pack. Sending it back posthaste.
customer_reviews.author: geargetter

customer_reviews.title: High Sierra Piranha Hydration Pack, Charcoal/Kelly, 10-Liter
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my son as he tends to often want to stop for a drink when we are out on bike rides. He absolutely loves the fact it does not leak, it fits his 10-yr old frame nicely & he can store his cell phone & keys in it (that's about all, too) I wouldn't hesitate in buying an identical unit if need be. In fact, I wish I had bought this for him a few years ago.
customer_reviews.author: End Uzer

customer_reviews.title: Great backpack!
customer_reviews.text: I'm happy with this backpack. It has convenient pockets and H2O!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer R. Von Dutch

customer_reviews.title: I love the design but need a more reliable product
customer_reviews.text: Since the day I bought it, the hose leaks. I love the design but need a more reliable product.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Only complaint is that it said it came ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Only complaint is that it said it came with 10 lt reservoir but actually comes with 2 lt.
customer_reviews.author: Christa

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable backpack, OK liquid holding
customer_reviews.text: I like the backpack its very comfortable. The only issue that I have is when it says 10 liters.....its not the capacity of the liquid portion of the backpack. This is referring to the entirety of the backpack. I was quite bummed about that. We wanted something very large for this particular outing and this just wasn't what we thought it would be.
customer_reviews.author: Jen G.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent pack for hydration while biking
customer_reviews.text: Excellent pack for hydration while biking. I don't use the bladder that came with it, though my daughter does. The included bladder tends to leak a little, but the pack is unbeatable for carrying just enough for a good 2-4 hour ride. Thoughtful elements on this pack for storage, organization, and expansion.
customer_reviews.author: J. R.

customer_reviews.title: Great bag. Not too much storage space when filled ...
customer_reviews.text: Great bag. Not too much storage space when filled with water, but enough to hold a sweater and some snacks on a good bike ride. The water bladder is decent but not as nice as the CamelBak brand since the bag opens up like a zip-lock bag (fully open at the top.) Not a twist lock type like the competitors. It makes for a bit more challenge to fill it up with water.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Crockett

customer_reviews.title: Arrived damaged...wish I noticed sooner...
customer_reviews.text: This arrived in damaged condition. The bladder was cracked underneath the plastic collar that seals the bladder. The plastic collar rubbed a hole in the back of the pack. And one of the straps at the top of the bag appears melted. I'm guessing this damage is from how it was stored. Unfortunately, I purchased this item as a gift and was opened after the return window had expired. I guess I could buy another bladder (and just deal with the hole in the bag), but needless to say, I'm very dissatisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Vernia

customer_reviews.title: Save your cash, get the CamelBak
customer_reviews.text: Backpack/daypak is ok, the water reservoir sucks. The water leaks from the clip, which is easily misplaced while filling, and the bladder must be kept upright at all times. In addition, the mouthpiece constantly leaks. Pay the money, get a CamelBak. The more you drink out of it the worse it gets.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: I was disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Within 20 minutes of my first hike, the bladder was leaking water. The bladder is open at the top. It must be folded over then slid into a "clamp" type of device. The clamp is then clipped to the top of the backpack, so that it sits upright in the backpack. Well, while the bladder is full of water it is heavy. As you walk it bounces up and down, and eventually (rather quickly) slides out of the clamp and is now open to leak water all over your back.
customer_reviews.author: John Giglio

customer_reviews.title: Good little pack.
customer_reviews.text: Looks and works great, easy fill and removal. Mouth piece leaks a little bit but nothing to stress over. Some of the other reviews stated the clip slides off? Mine is held on with a clip (AND 2 VELCRO STRAPS)? No problems to report in 300 miles of Mt Biking. with a full bag of water the pack holds my rain jacket, air pump, spare inner tube, tool kit and first aid bag. Pretty solid.
customer_reviews.author: K in Seattle

customer_reviews.title: Great bag
customer_reviews.text: Have bought one of these for each of my daughters. They love to take them when we go snowboarding so they don't have to stop to get drinks. Also great storage and neat helmet net that comes from the bottom pocket. Makes getting too and from the slopes easy. Can't wait to use them on hikes this year too!
customer_reviews.author: Kflat

customer_reviews.title: Cheap junk
customer_reviews.text: Terrible. The chest snap on the strap broke after one use. The bag is also very difficult to fill with liquid and actually close. Although I didn't even get to use it since the snap broke, I can see how this might leak very easily.
customer_reviews.author: Clinton Cimring

customer_reviews.title: Great for keeping hydrated in cold weather
customer_reviews.text: Great for keeping hydrated in cold weather. Very comfortable. Double chest straps allow cinching down for active sports like skiing.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: great pack for hiking
customer_reviews.text: This pack is absolutely wonderful!! Took with us to Hawaii and went on a 8 mile, 10 hr hike. It's light weight and held plenty of water to keep me hydrated on this beautiful hike to an amazing waterfall! Can't wait for the next hike!
customer_reviews.author: LYNDA HRYCAK

customer_reviews.title: Great pack. Terrible bladder.
customer_reviews.text: The pack portion of this item is great. Plenty of space, nice zippers, cool mesh pouch to secure windbreaker and other bulky items... BUT the bladder on this is horrendous. Actually the hose is fine, the bag itself is fine, but the method used to secure the water from spilling everywhere is a 'slide clip' that is supposed to keep the folded down bag secure. It does not work. I bent over, and the weight of the water dislodged the clip and water went everywhere. Not good on a long, hot, hike, where hydration is key! I quickly replaced the bladder withand everything is fine now, but don't trust the terribly designed bladder that this comes with.
customer_reviews.author: Keith B

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: They all leak from the mouthpiece. I have three of them and they all do it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael H. Hoepfinger

customer_reviews.title: A little over priced but seemed to be great quality and should last for a long time
customer_reviews.text: A little over priced but seemed to be great quality and should last for a long time. Lots of helpful pockets and extra room in it.
customer_reviews.author: Gene

customer_reviews.title: Durable with good space. Even if it did break in a ...
customer_reviews.text: On par with Camelback brand packs. Durable with good space. Even if it did break in a year, I could replace it 3 times compared to the cost of a CB
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wife loved it as a gift
customer_reviews.text: Wife loved it as a gift. Haven't used it yet but the water bladder and empty storage are the perfect size for a day hike.
customer_reviews.author: lance dicus

customer_reviews.title: Poor Design
customer_reviews.text: Zipper already broke. The design is very poor with the flap that covers the zipper. The flap lies too flat on top of the zipper always getting in the way. The straps also do not sit well on your shoulders. They have to be rubbing on your neck or sliding down your arms for the backpack to be in a usable position. I will never buy high sierra again.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Longwell

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice pack for the casual day packer. Very quality product.
customer_reviews.author: fillwis

customer_reviews.title: It was a great value and no compromise on quality
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my father in law. He loves it for hiking. It was a great value and no compromise on quality.
customer_reviews.author: LatenightAmazonshopper

customer_reviews.title: Good overall product
customer_reviews.text: Good overall product. Zippers catch on the overlap constantly. The plastic bag needs to be washed several times with hot water and baking soda to get out the plastic taste but it does go away. The bag doesn't vent in the back as well as I had hoped. Has a lot of room. Straps, once fit to your size, are comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: James A Cremeans

customer_reviews.title: He likes it and I like how easy it is to get all the water ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my 12yo Boy Scout. He likes it and I like how easy it is to get all the water out in prepping for storage.
customer_reviews.author: Z. Marek

customer_reviews.title: Works as intended. I have no issues with leaks ...
customer_reviews.text: Works as intended. I have no issues with leaks as others reviews have mentioned. Just make sure you don't over fill. Line clearly marks
customer_reviews.author: Emil Hans Ysona

customer_reviews.title: unreliable at best
customer_reviews.text: After washing it, it still tasted like oil. The clip that holds bladder closed would not stay on.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick S. Bennett

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: heavier than I thought it would be, storage area small, mouth piece leaked
customer_reviews.author: Marion Doreen

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value!
customer_reviews.text: Bought it as a gift for my dad and he loves it. Excellent value!
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size for our day trips and Pokemon hunting
customer_reviews.text: We got these after seeing my son's in action. Perfect size for our day trips and Pokemon hunting! Super comfortable, room for snacks, wallets, etc. So happy
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Affordable Hydratation Pack
customer_reviews.text: Not the prettiest hydratation pack out there, but has a reasonable price and most importantly gets the job done. It is my first HP, so I don't really have something to compare it to. But so far, I'm happy with its performance.
customer_reviews.author: Sebastian Guerrero

customer_reviews.title: When I first got it the bagged worked fine for about a week
customer_reviews.text: When I first got it the bagged worked fine for about a week. But now the clip that connects to the bladder is leaking. I was highly upset when everything in my bag was wet. I don't know if it was just my bag or if its a manufacturing problem
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Etienne

customer_reviews.title: My go to adventure pack
customer_reviews.text: Love it, no to big, not to small, perfect for raves an hikes
customer_reviews.author: Richard R.

customer_reviews.title: Great for out doors or even simply to go out ...
customer_reviews.text: Great for out doors or even simply to go out at a amusement parks! Easy to clean and fill!
customer_reviews.author: Cmaynor

customer_reviews.title: Worked out perfectly.
customer_reviews.text: Worked out perfectly. 2 liter capacity more than enough I bring with me when I do strenuous hikes more than 5 miles long
customer_reviews.author: Frenchie760

customer_reviews.title: The bag itself works fine (at least since for the several times used)
customer_reviews.text: The bag itself works fine (at least since for the several times used), but the water bag start leaking from the very beginning.
customer_reviews.author: Iftach Haitner

customer_reviews.title: I love this product
customer_reviews.text: I love this product. I have had it for well over a year and it has held up great. Perfect for moderate hikers!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I used this for my Spartan super and it worked really good.
customer_reviews.author: wanda tranquillo

customer_reviews.title: love it even comes with a net for your helmit ...
customer_reviews.text: love it even comes with a net for your helmit wich i use for every thing. space wise if u take out the blader i can fit a pair of jeans 2 t's socks underwear oneand zip it up just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Figueroa

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great back pack but hydration bag not so great. Water leaking through mouth piece.
customer_reviews.author: Iosif Kimatov

customer_reviews.title: but the quality looks great, i just hope this would not
customer_reviews.text: haven't try it yet, but the quality looks great, i just hope this would not leak
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: My favorite hydration pack!
customer_reviews.text: I've had one of these for a few years now, but our dogs got ahold of it and ruined the water pack so I decided to purchase another. I love this pack, it is the perfect size and everything. We use them a lot when hiking or going on long bike rides. It hold the right amount of water and then there is still room to put other essential items you might need. Definitely would recommend to anyone looking for one!
customer_reviews.author: Alanah White

customer_reviews.title: Bad design. The bladder slips and water go everywhere ...
customer_reviews.text: Bad design. The bladder slips and water go everywhere when i used it just the first time, and the bladder went broken after 5th use.
customer_reviews.author: Matrix Trueman

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Perfect hydration pack for day hikes. Great quality and even better price.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I received package early and I was very pleased with the items, thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Ruby

customer_reviews.title: Great comfortable day pack
customer_reviews.text: Great backpack. Perfect for a day hike. I would have given 5 stars if the hydration bladder hose was easier to clean/dry like my camelback.
customer_reviews.author: koatwork

customer_reviews.title: Lots of storage which is good
customer_reviews.text: To fill the pack, you have to slide a clamp off and it completely opens up the bag. Does not seem very secure and possibly could leak everywhere. Lots of storage which is good though
customer_reviews.author: Dewey

customer_reviews.title: Great for a quick day-hike
customer_reviews.text: Great for a quick day-hike... except that the neoprene insulator around the tub to the water bladder is already fraying.
customer_reviews.author: BCJTL

customer_reviews.title: This pack is garbage. It broke instantly and the whole design is ...
customer_reviews.text: This pack is garbage. It broke instantly and the whole design is completely flawed. I found myself on a long, hot hike with a leaking useless piece of crap. Please, please do yourself a favor and spend the extra $20-40 and buy something better.
customer_reviews.author: Mary K. Newkirk

customer_reviews.title: Nice bag
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had any leakage like other reviewers say but I can definitely see how that would happen. Kind of waiting for the day it does happen tho. Great starter bag if you're just getting into hiking and don't want to break the bank.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I love the quality and all the pockets are useful.
customer_reviews.author: Veeki

customer_reviews.title: Great pack for day to day use
customer_reviews.text: Great pack for day to day use! I'm working At a summer camp right now, and I use it everyday!
customer_reviews.author: Robert Jones

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Not quite enough easy storage pockets. However, for the price it's OK.
customer_reviews.author: John S. Franden

customer_reviews.title: not what i expected
customer_reviews.text: too expensive for the quality, water bag very cheep looking and spills water. the back pack it self aint too bad but could use a better water bag.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: not usede
customer_reviews.text: It was a gift and has not been used yet. It will be used in Peru in May 2014. Looks OK.
customer_reviews.author: Louis B. Hilderbrand

customer_reviews.title: MIS ADVERTISING
customer_reviews.text: The ad said 10liters. I was hoping for a 10 liter water bag... It only says 2 liter...I'm really dissatisfied with the product..how can I return this and get my money back
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: so it is exposed to the elements and quickly becomes dirty.
customer_reviews.text: The pack itself is spacious and handy. My problem is with the bite valve, which started leaking after 2-3 uses. It quickly became unusable without the pack spewing water out all over me. Also, there is no cover for the bite valve, so it is exposed to the elements and quickly becomes dirty.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Use this for walks/runs with my dog. Has extra ...
customer_reviews.text: Use this for walks/runs with my dog. Has extra pockets for keeping his leash in and my phone so that stays secure while I listen to music. I just run the headphones out the zipper.
customer_reviews.author: Sir Trever The Magnificent

customer_reviews.title: The mouth piece leaks. I'm not sure if it's ...
customer_reviews.text: The mouth piece leaks. I'm not sure if it's an elevation issue (around 10,000 ft) or what but the mouth piece leaks significantly. Enough to soak my arm on the hike. Very disappointing. Aside from that the bag fits plenty of gear for a day hike. If you get this bag watch the leakage or get a replacement mouth piece.
customer_reviews.author: kk02076

customer_reviews.title: Not good for music festivals
customer_reviews.text: I bought this at my local Meijer to take with me to Electric Forest 2016 (music festival that's 4 days long) It worked great, but it's a giant pain to refill. Especially after a few drinks. After the festival, it was ruined. It leaked out of the mouthpiece and the corners of the water bag. I wish I had just used the money I spent on this to buy a higher quality one, but if you're in a pinch it'll do. Just fill it BEFORE you party.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Slide doesn't hold the bladder well. Will get you soaked,
customer_reviews.text: I will be returning this backpack. During my only run with it the bladder kept slipping out of the slide and water went everywhere. I bought it originally because it was more comfortable than others. Very poor design. It looks like others have had the same issue.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: This backpack was great..
customer_reviews.text: This backpack was great...until it ripped after very few times of use. Seems like some part of the design was faulty or material. Didn't last at all.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Made in China junk
customer_reviews.text: Get this if you enjoy a soaked backside. The water pouch is folded and held together by a clip. The bag slowly slides out of the clip so you think it's secure, then lets loose after you jog for a few minutes or go over a few bumps. Ridiculous. I wore it for maybe an hour, with nothing in it but water and the bottom seam is already torn. There's a giant tag inside that says made in China. 50 bucks for a tiny backpack, I expected better. I thought I was getting a decent brand, but evidently I was wrong. I've contacted the company, I'll update with the results...maybe the customer service is better than the product? Here's hoping!
customer_reviews.author: Crazyinsatiable1

product_meta.title: High Sierra Piranha Hydration Pack
product_meta.description: High Sierra Piranha Hydration pack is perfect for Road Biking, Trail Running & Hiking. All of the latest technology can be found right here in our tech series packs. Lightweight fabrics and hardware are combined with the latest in stretched-mesh back design to create the best High Sierra packs yet. The Tech Series offers the right mix of comfort, technology and style for the serious outdoor enthusiast.
feature_bullets: Add-A-Bag attachment loops for securing the pack to a larger bag 2-liter Quench Hydration System has a wide opening reservoir for easy filling and cleaning. System is BPA free and antimicrobial.
Insulated Thermo-Sleeve hose cover prevents water from freezing in the tube. Elastic loops for convenient hydration hose positioning.
Large, front-load main compartment holds gear. Organizer with key fob holds bicycle tools, accessories. Stretch-mesh front pocket for external storage.
Airflow back panel helps channel moisture. Lightweight shoulder straps with adjustable sternum strap. Side compression straps stabilize loads.
Tuck-away mesh sport flap holds a helmet. Removable waist belt allows the bag to be customized for each activity. Reflective loop holds bike LED blinker.
